clues.text:
"The Wizard of Oz":
It's the capital of Oz

"The Hunger Games":
This country with 12 districts

"The Handmaid's Tale":
The repressive Christian republic of this

"Lost Horizon":
This utopian lamasery in Tibet

In a Samuel Butler satire:
Colleges of Unreason are found in this title land
"And they were both naked, the man and his wife, and were not ashamed" in this Bible book
This magazine that pretty much owns the nude pregnant celebrity cover showcased Serena Williams in August 2017
This almost hairless rodent is also called the naked blesmol
She was first naked in the world sometime around 1912; getting naked later led to a 1959 Broadway musical based on her life
"O" my, said viewers at the Salon of 1865 on seeing this very un-romanticized nude by Manet
A story on Prince William's leg injury prompted an investigation into News Corp reporters hacking these devices
In "The Insider", Russell Crowe played a real-life whistleblower for this industry
Attempts to hide this 1986 accident lasted 2 days before Swedish monitoring stations detected radiation
A 1977 article in Mother Jones magazine reported that Ford knew that this car had fuel tank problems in crashes
One thread that unraveled the LAPD Rampart scandal: cops moonlighting as security for this "morbid" record label
In "The 59th Street Bridge Song", Simon & Garfunkel were "kicking down the cobblestones, looking for fun &" doing this subtitle
This man wrote, & then sang, "When Scooter & the big man bust this city in half... Tenth Avenue freeze-out"
On "461 Ocean Boulevard", his album & onetime address, this blues master went reggae with "I Shot The Sheriff"
"Tumbling Dice" & "Happy" were 2 of the 18 tunes released in 1972 when the Rolling Stones faced "Exile" here
In 1978 this singer-songwriter parked "Big Shot" & "Honesty" on "52nd Street"
"Parental" this is "given on a minor's behalf... for the minor to engage in or submit to a specified activity"
"The act... of officially nullifying punishment or other legal consequences of a crime"
"A person who settles on property without any legal claim or title"
"A writ... directing a law enforcer to make an arrest, a search, or a seizure"
"The judicial procedure by which a testamentary document is established to be a valid will"

rounds.comments: (Alex: You have to correct each title that we kind of messed up a bit on.)

clues.text: "Rosencrantz and Morgenstern Are Dead"
"Lady Windermere's Farm"
"The 25th Annual Putnam County Quilting Bee"
"Stock Characters in Search of an Author"
clues.response: Six Characters in Search of an Author

clues.text: "The Lady's Not for Beaming"
"The Lord did bring the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt by their armies" is in this Bible book
Throwing doubles 3 straight times lands you in jail in this game; one double thrown over your next 3 rolls gets you out
Celebs who've had this nightclub job include Vin Diesel (easy to picture) & Pope Francis (less)
Asked to leave, you may get your marching orders or these blanking blanks
The Huguenots fled France after the Edict of this was revoked in 1685
Starting c. 600 there were fewer free peasants & more of these lowliest people, bonded to a nobleman's estate
In 1830 at age 72 this hero of the American Revolution played a key role in France's July Rev. that changed kings
Albania became majority Muslim during its 500-year occupation by this empire
He formed the Redshirts while fighting in South America before leading the group to Italy
In 1967, after a military takeover by Colonel George Papadopoulos, this Greek king fled to Italy

rounds.comments: (Alex: The correct response will be a shorter word that is found inside the clue. For instance, if I said "A feline inside a teacher", the correct response will be, "What is cat?" Because you find "cat" in "educator".)

clues.text: A walking aid inside another word for a pirate
A shopping complex inside a contagious viral killer of old
An insect home inside little green things atop a baked potato
A noisemaker inside an extra large cremini mushroom
A narrow road inside a type of celestial body
This title character doesn't eat Gary's disfigured villain in a "Silence of the Lambs" sequel--boars do
Harrison Ford really means it when he tells Gary, "Get off my plane!" in this movie
It is far from a spoiler to say this man played by Gary Oldman in "JFK" does not live to see the end of the film
In 1992 Winona Ryder took a big bite out of Gary, who got stabbed in the heart & then beheaded as this title guy
To protect Mathilda, played by this actress in her 1994 film debut, "The Professional" blows up Gary's crooked cop
A superior knitted pullover
A fancy coffee-colored full-length dress
A small handheld evening bag from Holland
A wrapped headdress for Muslim men, designed to be worn in the city
A detachable shirt front once worn with tuxedos that was perplexing & difficult to deal with
On July 14, 1789 a French mob demanded arms & munitions from this prison; the guards resisted & the rest is history
The Mexican Army under Santa Anna began a siege of this mission on February 23, 1836
American patriots dressed as Mohawks for this festive event on December 16, 1773
This passenger ship sank in less than 20 minutes after being hit by torpedoes on May 7, 1915
Abraham Lincoln was shot on this date, Good Friday of that year

rounds.text: Plutarch quotes this man who sentenced many to death: "Small ones deserve that, and I have no higher for the greater crimes"
